item.title: Croissant
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Instructions Activate Yeast: In a bowl, combine warm milk, active dry yeast, and a pinch of sugar. Let it sit for about 5-10 minutes until it becomes frothy. Prepare Dough: In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt. Add the yeast mixture to the dry ingredients and mix until...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • 1 1/4 cups warm milk (110°F/45°C)
  • 2 tablespoons active dry yeast
  • 1/4 cup granulated sugar
  • 4 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for dusting
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 1/4 cups unsalted butter, cold
  • 1 egg (for egg wash)

Instructions

Activate Yeast:

In a bowl, combine warm milk, active dry yeast, and a pinch of sugar. Let it sit for about 5-10 minutes until it becomes frothy.

Prepare Dough:

In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar, and salt. Add the yeast mixture to the dry ingredients and mix until a dough forms. Knead the dough on a floured surface for about 5-10 minutes until it becomes smooth.

Rolling and Folding:

Roll out the dough into a rectangle, about 1/4 inch thick. Place thin slices of cold butter evenly over two-thirds of the dough. Fold the dough like a letter (fold one-third over, then fold the remaining third on top). Roll out the dough again, then fold it again. Repeat this process 3-4 times, chilling the dough between each fold.

Chill the Dough:

Shape the Croissants:

Roll out the chilled dough into a large rectangle. Cut the rectangle into smaller triangles. Roll each triangle tightly from the wider end to the tip, forming a crescent shape.

Proofing:

Place the shaped croissants on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Cover them with a clean kitchen towel and let them rise in a warm place for 1-2 hours, or until doubled in size.

Baking:

Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C).Beat an egg and brush it over the tops of the croissants for a golden finish.

Cooling:

Allow the croissants to cool on a wire rack before serving. Wrap the dough in plastic wrap and refrigerate for at least 2 hours or overnight. Bake for 15-20 minutes or until the croissants are golden brown and flaky.

Published by

– Gimhan –

item.title: Roti Canai
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Instructions Prepare the Dough: In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt. Add the sweetened condensed milk and egg (if using). Gradually add water and mix until the dough comes together. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic. Let it rest for at...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • 4 cups all-purpose flour
  • 1 teaspoon salt
  • 1 tablespoon sweetened condensed milk
  • 1 egg (optional)
  • Water, as needed
  • Ghee (clarified butter) or vegetable oil for cooking

Instructions

Prepare the Dough:

In a large mixing bowl, combine the all-purpose flour and salt. Add the sweetened condensed milk and egg (if using). Gradually add water and mix until the dough comes together. Knead the dough on a floured surface until it becomes smooth and elastic. Let it rest for at least 4 hours, or overnight for better results.

Divide and Shape:

After the resting period, divide the dough into golf ball-sized portions. Roll each portion into a smooth ball, then dip it in ghee or oil to coat lightly.

Flattening the Dough:

On a well-greased surface, flatten each ball with your hands, stretching it as thin as possible without tearing. You can also use a well-greased rolling pin for this.

Stretching the Roti:

Pick up the flattened dough from the edges and gently stretch it by swinging it back and forth. The goal is to make it thin and almost translucent.

Cooking:

Heat a flat pan or griddle on medium-high heat. Place the stretched dough onto the hot surface. Cook each side for about 1-2 minutes or until it turns golden brown, brushing with ghee or oil as needed.

Published by

– Irusha –

item.title: Chicken Pea and Broth
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Method STEP 1Heat the chicken stock in a pan, then add the rice or pasta and cook until just tender (about 8 minutes). Add the chicken and peas and cook for 1 minute until heated through. Season, stir through the parsley and serve. Published by – Methuja – For chef reviews on this recipe:...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • 750ml chicken stock
  • 50g rice or orzo
  • 1 skinless cooked chicken breast, shredded
  • 50g frozen peas, defrosted
  • a small handful flat-leaf parsley, chopped

Method

STEP 1
Heat the chicken stock in a pan, then add the rice or pasta and cook until just tender (about 8 minutes). Add the chicken and peas and cook for 1 minute until heated through. Season, stir through the parsley and serve.

Published by

– Methuja –

item.title: Gravy
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Instructions Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once the skillet is hot, add the butter and let melt. Once the butter is melted, whisk in the flour until well incorporated and cook for another 30 seconds to 1 minute. Next, slowly whisk in the pan drippings until they are all well...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • pan drippings from roasted chicken or 1/4 cup butter
  • 1/4 cup all purpose flour
  • 2 cups chicken stock or broth
  • salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste

Instructions

Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Once the skillet is hot, add the butter and let melt. Once the butter is melted, whisk in the flour until well incorporated and cook for another 30 seconds to 1 minute. Next, slowly whisk in the pan drippings until they are all well incorporated. Next, slowly pour in the chicken broth, whisking continuously as you pour it in. Give the gravy a taste and season with salt and pepper and let cook for for two to three more minutes until it has thickened to your desired consistency. Once the gravy has thickened to your desired consistency, remove it from the heat. Transfer to a serving dish and serve immediately.

Published by

– Praveen-

item.title: Turkish Eggs
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Method STEP 1Put the greek yogurt in a large bowl and whisk in the garlic, dill, olive oil and some seasoning. Leave on the side while you prep the rest of the ingredients so the yogurt can lose the chill of the fridge. STEP 2Heat the butter in a small pan until...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • 150ml greek yogurt
  • ½ a clove garlic, crushed
  • finely chopped to make 1 tbsp dill
  • 1 tbsp olive oil
  • 3 tbsp salted butter
  • ½ tsp hot smoked paprika
  • 2 eggs, (as fresh as possible)
  • a small handful flat-leaf parsley, chopped
  • 2 slices sourdough, griddled

Method

STEP 1
Put the greek yogurt in a large bowl and whisk in the garlic, dill, olive oil and some seasoning. Leave on the side while you prep the rest of the ingredients so the yogurt can lose the chill of the fridge.

STEP 2
Heat the butter in a small pan until melted, stir in the paprika and leave over a low heat.

STEP 3
Poach the eggs by gently cracking into a pan of just-simmering water. Leave for 2-3 minutes then scoop out with a slotted spoon and gently poke the yolk to see if it is done to your liking. Drain on kitchen paper.

STEP 4
Divide the yogurt between 2 bowls. Add an egg to each then drizzle over the paprika butter and sprinkle with a little parsley. Serve with the sourdough for dunking.

Published by

– Methuja –

item.title: Gazpach Sauce Spaghetti
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Method STEP 1Cook the pasta following pack instructions until al dente. STEP 2Meanwhile, put the tomatoes, pepper, garlic and onion into a blender and whizz until completely smooth. Season, then stir in the sherry vinegar and Tabasco. STEP 3Once the pasta is cooked, drain well and toss with the sauce. Tear in...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • 160g spaghetti
  • 250g cherry tomatoes
  • 1 green pepper, chopped
  • ½ a clove garlic
  • ½ red onion, roughly chopped
  • 1 tbsp sherry vinegar
  • a good dash Tabasco
  • a small bunch basil

Method

STEP 1
Cook the pasta following pack instructions until al dente.

STEP 2
Meanwhile, put the tomatoes, pepper, garlic and onion into a blender and whizz until completely smooth. Season, then stir in the sherry vinegar and Tabasco.

STEP 3
Once the pasta is cooked, drain well and toss with the sauce. Tear in lots of basil and serve

Published by

– Tharindu –

item.title: Hot Smoked Salmon Salad With Chive Buttermilk Dressing
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Method STEP 1To make the dressing, whisk together the buttermilk, vinegar, sugar and some seasoning and stir in the chives. STEP 2Add the lettuce to a large bowl with the sugar snaps, red onion and capers and toss gently. Pour in 1/2 the dressing and toss again. Flake over the salmon and...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • 2 Little Gem, cut into chunky pieces
  • 50g sugar snap peas, halved
  • 1 red onion, thinly sliced
  • 2 tbsp capers
  • 150g hot-smoked salmon
  • crusty bread, to serve (optional)

Method

STEP 1
To make the dressing, whisk together the buttermilk, vinegar, sugar and some seasoning and stir in the chives.

STEP 2
Add the lettuce to a large bowl with the sugar snaps, red onion and capers and toss gently. Pour in 1/2 the dressing and toss again. Flake over the salmon and gently toss again.

STEP 3
Tip into a serving bowl, drizzle over the rest of the dressing and serve with crusty bread, if you like.

Published by

– Dilshan –

item.title: Chicken Spiralized Salad
item.dc:creator: Recipshare
item.description: Ingredients Method STEP 1Layer the salad ingredients into 2 plastic containers if you’re packing to take to work, or put them in a large bowl. Make the dressing by combining all the ingredients in a jar with a lid, add some seasoning and shake well. Put the dressing in 2 small pots to...
item.content:encoded:
Ingredients

  • ½ cucumber, spiralized or sliced into ribbons
  • 2 carrots, spiralized or sliced into ribbons
  • 100g bag crisp salad leaves (a mix of radicchio, frisée and round lettuce)
  • 4 spring onions, finely sliced
  • 200g pack roast chicken pieces
  • 2 tsp sesame seed

Method

STEP 1
Layer the salad ingredients into 2 plastic containers if you’re packing to take to work, or put them in a large bowl. Make the dressing by combining all the ingredients in a jar with a lid, add some seasoning and shake well. Put the dressing in 2 small pots to pack into your lunchboxes, or toss through the salad if eating straight away.

Published by

– Rashmie –
